documents.title: do androids dream of electric footballers ?
text: computer scientists at university of southampton are testing an artificially intelligent tool for predicting premier league football results .

documents.title: breakingtrump : ceos are not taking their jobs seriously
text: donald trump claims that the chief executives who have left his manufacturing advisory committee did so `` because they 're not taking their jobs seriously as it pertains to this country '' .

the us president said they are leaving the council `` out of embarrassment '' because `` i have been lecturing them '' about them making their products outside of america .

documents.title: kpmg to pay $ 6.2m to settle us audit claim
text: accountancy firm kpmg will pay $ 6.2m to settle charges in the us that it failed to properly audit the financial statements of oil and gas company miller energy resources .

the securities and exchange commission said kpmg did not admit or deny the agency 's findings that the company and a partner improperly audited miller energy resources in 2011 `` resulting in investors being misinformed about the energy company 's value '' .

documents.title: johnson & johnson chief to remain on trump council
text: alex gorsky , the chairman & chief executive of johnson & johnson , says that he will remain on donald trump 's manufacturing advisory council .
commenting on the chief executives who have decided to leave the council , mr gorsky says : `` i respect their decision as a matter of personal conscience . ''
he adds : `` given the events of the past few days , i can understand the concerns - even the fear - that some people have expressed .
these are difficult days for everyone .

in the end , i have concluded that johnson & johnson has a responsibility to remain engaged , not as a way to support any specific political agenda , but as a way to represent the values of our credo as crucial public policy is discussed and developed . ''

documents.title: walmart : trump missed chance to unify us
text: the chief executive of retail walmart has given his verdict on the us president 's response to the deadly violence in charlottesville .

documents.title: sportswear chain in 20 % share slump

the announcement comes a fortnight after it emerged that the us army had prohibited its troops from using the chinese firm 's equipment because of unspecified cyber-security concerns .
dji told the bbc that it had already been working on the new facility , but had speeded up development after the ban .
the mode should be launched next month .

text: it was spend , spend , spend for americans last month .

the uk 's alternative proposal - a more efficient system of border checks - would involve `` an increase in administration '' , it admits .

documents.title: all employers 'should offer flexible hours '
text: all british employers should offer flexible hours to both sexes to make life fairer for working parents , the country 's equality watchdog has said .
job shares and working from home are key to boost women 's salaries , the equality and human rights commission ( ehrc ) said , noting british women earn 18 % less than men for the same job .

`` we need to overhaul our culture and make flexible working the norm - looking beyond women as the primary caregivers and having tough conversations about the biases that are rife in our workforce and society , '' said caroline waters , ehrc 's deputy chairwoman .

documents.title: ftse holds gains
text: london 's benchmark index remains in positive territory as the pound languishes after the release of lower-than-expected inflation data .
the ftse 100 is up 0.5 % at 7,392.26 points , buoyed by a number of broker upgrades and gains for consumer staple stocks .
bae systems , up 2.4 % , is top of the leader board followed by construction firm crh - up 2.2 % .
the pound is down 0.7 % against the dollar at $ 1.28680 , after the prospect of a rate rise this year receded .

documents.title: air berlin files for insolvency
text: germany 's second-largest carrier , air berlin , has filed for insolvency after a restructuring plan failed to stem its soaring losses .
it comes after its main shareholder etihad airways said it `` would not provide any further financial support '' to the struggling firm .
the german government has provided a 150m euro bridging loan to keep flights going , while german rival lufthansa revealed it was in talks with air berlin to take over parts of the group .

documents.title: man dies in fall at stock exchange

city of london police said they are not treating the incident as sus

a police spokesman said : `` we were called to the london stock exchange in paternoster square ( ec4 ) on tuesday , 15 august at 9.58am to a report of a man who had fallen from an upper floor in the building to the ground .

documents.title: home depot posts surprise jump in profit
text: us home improvement giant home depot has reported higher-than-expected quarterly profits , despite weak demand across america 's retail landscape more generally .
in the three months to 30 july , sales at stores open for more than a year rose 6.3 % , above the 4.9 % expected by analysts .
net income went from $ 2.44bn to $ 2.67bn .
americans have been investing more in their homes as the housing market heats up and prices rise .

documents.title: rbs to 'cut 880 it jobs '
text: rbs is to cut 880 it jobs by 2020 , says union unite .
it said royal bank of scotland had informed staff of a further 40 % cut in jobs at the bank 's london office .
coupled with a 65 % cut in the number of contractors employed by the bank , the total reduction would be 880 , the union said .
branding the cuts `` wholly unacceptable '' , unite said there would be only 950 full-time it staff by 2020 , compared with 2,200 in 2016 .

documents.title: domino 's missing a slice of expected profit .
text: shares of australian fast food chain domino 's pizza enterprises fell more than 20 % on tuesday after investors decided its full-year profit expectations had no cheese in the crust .
the company 's underlying net profit grew 28.8 % , which is short of company forecasts for growth of 32.5 % .
the australian arm of domino 's is the biggest outside the us , and holds the franchise rights for seven countries .
the company says the disappointing result was due to problems with its online platform in france , and poor sales in japan .

documents.title: more inflation 'in the pipeline '
text: we 've heard from a couple of analysts who reckon that uk inflation is close to peaking , or could have peaked already .
but yael selfin , chief economist at kpmg uk , reckons inflation could still accelerate over the next few months .
`` the slide in the value of the pound over the past year has put significant pressure on companies ' margins .
we have seen some of these costs passed on to consumers but there 's likely to be more in the pipeline .

`` the recent rise in the price of oil , the further weakness of the pound against the euro , along with a resilient economy - albeit growing at a slower pace - are all likely to encourage further rises to consumer prices .
`` our current projections are for inflation to peak early next year , and average around 2.6 % over the next two years . ''

documents.title: has inflation peaked ?
text: more from neil wilson of etx capital on the inflation data , which has led him to ponder if the rate will go any higher .
`` cpi is still expected to peak at 3 % later this year before easing back , yet there are signs that inflation may have already peaked , '' he says .
`` the sterling exchange rate has stabilised , meaning far less pass-through from the weaker pound on the inflation rate .
`` if inflation has peaked , it would be good news for british workers , with wages still falling in real terms it would also be good news for the uk 's consumer-driven economy . ''

documents.title: sterling slips on inflation figures
text: the pound is now down 0.35 % against the dollar at $ 1.29190 .

`` the data does n't radically alter the view on the bank of england , but it certainly cements the belief that a rate hike this year now looks highly unlikely .
the market was positioned for a bit more inflation than we 're getting . ''

documents.title: rpi 'not a good measure ' - ons

we know there will be a focus on the rpi this month , but the national statistician has been clear it is not a good measure and we do not recommend its use , '' he said .

documents.title: consumer prices 'close to topping out '

`` in their latest inflation report , the bank of england forecast inflation to peak at 3 % in the autumn , and will be happy to keep interest rates on hold as a result . ''

documents.title: cpi figure gives boe 'wiggle room '
text: david cheetham , chief market analyst at brokers xtb , says the smaller than expected increase in inflation for july has given the bank of england `` a little more wiggle room ''

`` the rise of 2.6 % is lower than the consensus forecast for a 2.7 % rise today 's number marks the second successive lower than expected reading for this widely viewed measure of inflation and the strong rise seen since the start of the year appears to have been halted .

`` even though the reading is significantly above the 2 % target for the boe the fact that it is below forecast will be pleasing to governor carney and the other members of the mpc and will allow the rate-setting committee a little more leeway when it comes to policy decisions going forward . ''

documents.title: 'petrol prices continue to fall '
text: the consumer prices index climbed 2.6 % year on year in july 2017 , unchanged from june 2017 .
the ons said the price of motor fuel continued to fall and provided the largest downward contribution to change in the rate between june 2017 and july 2017 .
this was offset by smaller upward contributions from a range of goods and services , including clothing , household goods , gas and electricity , and food and non-alcoholic beverages .

documents.title: breakinginflation figures announced
text: the consumer price index rose 2.6 % in july - the same as in june .
the retail price index - which will determine the price at which rail fares can rise in 2018 - climbed 3.6 % , up from 3.5 % .

documents.title: pound slips ahead of inflation figures
text: the pound has slipped ahead of the release of inflation figures for july .
it 's down 0.1 % against the dollar at $ 1.29480 .
inflation is widely tipped to rise after a surprise fall last month .

documents.title: could cornwall see a mining revival ?
text: as avid poldark viewers will be aware , mining in cornwall was a significant industry and you can still see remnants of it across the cornish landscape .
that was for copper and tin - the future it seems could lie in the highly reactive metal , lithium .
a company called cornish lithium is behind plans to tap into potential reserves of the precious metal and has raised £ 1 million in funding to do so .
the modern day poldark running the business is jeremy wrathall .
a mining analyst by trade , he stumbled upon historic records of the presence of lithium in water in the cornish mines dating back to the 1860s , and decided to try and and extract it .
when it was first discovered in the region , it was seen as a bit of a peculiarity .
now though , the market for lithium is flourishing as demand for electric cars and rechargeable batteries soars .
wrathall claims that there will be minimal environmental damage as they drill exploratory holes .
he says he is using the new funding to explore the possibility of commercialising production of the metal , and if he 's successful it could create a major new industry in the region .
author: Katie Prescott
Today business presenter

documents.title: ftse winners and losers
text: let 's have a look at who 's top of the ftse leader board .
following the completion of the merger between satandard life and aberdeen asset management , shares in the new company - standard life aberdeen - have climbed 2.4 % .
the next best performers are pharma company shire , up 1.7 % , and defence contractor bae systems , up 1.1 % .
shares in hargreaves lansdown have fallen 1.5 % , despite the firm posting a 21 % jump in profits .
on the ftse 250 , mears dropped more than 10 % after the firm warned revenues and profits will be hit as a result of the grenfell tower fire .

documents.title: record-sized data centre planned inside arctic circle
text: plans to build the world 's `` largest '' data centre are being made public .
the facility is set to be created at the norwegian town of ballangen , which is located inside the arctic circle .
the firm behind the project , kolos , says the chilled air and abundant hydropower available locally would help it keep its energy costs down .
the area , however , suffers the country 's highest rate of sick leave from work , which may be related to its past as a mining community .

it 's up 11.17 points , or 0.15 % , at 7,365.06 .

documents.title: profits jump at hargreaves lansdown
text: hargreaves lansdown has posted a 21 % rise in profits after more consumers invested in the stock market .
it booked pre-tax earnings of £ 265.8m for the year ending 30 june , on net revenue of £ 385.6m - both up around 20 % year-on-year .
meanwhile its assets under administration rose by 28 % to £ 79.2bn .

documents.title: asian markets breathe sigh of relief over korea
text: asian markets headed higher on tuesday , as investors breathed a collective sigh of relief that tensions between the us and north korea did n't worsen over the weekend .
south korea 's kospi closed up 0.6 % and the won rebounded from a one-month low , while japan 's nikkei surged more than 1 % .

hong kong 's hang seng also edged higher , as did the major mainland indexes , apparently unfazed by us president donald trump 's decision to order a inquiry into china 's intellectual property practices .

documents.title: nightclub giant pursues revolution takeover
text: nightclub giant deltic is urging shareholders in the revolution chain of bars to accept a takeover offer that was spurned by its board .
the firm said a merger would create `` a powerhouse group '' that could both `` expand and consolidate the market '' .
it also denounced a rival offer from stonegate pubs as `` opportunistic '' .
revolution has so far spurned discussions with deltic , which hinted that its bid could turn hostile .
`` subsequent to this announcement , deltic would encourage revolution to reconsider its position and engage in meaningful discussions with deltic towards the pursuit of a potential merger . ''
it has until 12 september to decide on whether to make a formal offer for the firm .

documents.title: firms 'still passing on brexit-related costs to consumers '
text: the inflation figure for july - out at 9.30am - should rise to 2.8 % , says yael selfin , kpmg 's chief economist .
firms still have n't passed on to consumers all of the costs of the fall in the pound since the brexit vote , she adds .
further falls in the pound against the euro and an increase in oil prices have also been weighing on the economy , and wages are not keeping pace .

`` it 's been a surprise that wages have n't caught up given the tightness of the labour market , but generally we expect wages not to rise as much as prices this year and this will leave consumers with less disposable income , '' ms selfin says .

documents.title: competition regulator considers oil merger remedies
text: regulators are mulling a plan to overcome competition concerns regarding the merger of two oil services firms .

wood group wants to buy amec foster wheeler , but the competition and markets authority fears it would curb competition in the supply of engineering , construction and maintenance services to the uk oil industry .
the firms have agreed to sell off a range of assets to ease the path of the deal , and the regulator is considering the proposal .
it it finds the plan does n't go far enough , however , the merger could be referred for an in-depth investigation and subjected to more far-reaching remedies , or even stopped .

documents.title: railways offering 'value for money '
text: passenger groups say the expected 3.5 % cap on rail fare increases in 2018 will be too high , given the industry 's patchy performance .
but paul plummer , chief executive at the railway group , the trade body for the railway industry , says services are improving .
`` over many decades we did n't invest enough in british railways and over the last decade we have been catching up , '' he told today .
`` the money from fares goes to improving the railway and boosts the economy .
`` over the next 18 months there will be many more seats and an increase in routes available . ''

BBC Radio 4

documents.title: shoppers help german growth
text: germany 's economy grew by 0.6 % in the second quarter of the year , according to the country 's federal statistics office .
strong spending by households in the quarter was offset by the net trade position , as imports grew faster than exports .
the 0.6 % figure was slightly slower than expected , although the growth rate for the first three months of the year was revised up to 0.7 % from an earlier estimate of 0.6 % .

documents.title: temporary customs union would give 'breathing space '
text: adam marshal , director general of the british chambers of commerce , says the uk 's call for a temporary customs union after brexit would give firms `` breathing space '' .
any change in customs arrangements for british businesses after 40 years `` is going to take some time to adjust to '' , he says .
`` having a sensible transition period is the right thing to - now we need to get brussels to move it up the agenda . ''
he says stable customs arrangements would enable firms to continue doing business and keep their costs down .

BBC Radio 4

documents.title: uber resumes service in philippines , despite ban
text: the ride-hailing app uber has resumed service in the philippines today , despite a one-month ban handed down by the land transportation franchising and regulatory board .
the board issued an order for uber to halt the service over it 's defiance of an order to cease accepting new driver applications .
uber said it had appealed the one-month suspension , and was resuming services as it awaited for a decision .

documents.title: plan for temporary customs union 'offers more certainty '
text: the government 's proposals for a temporary customs union with the eu after britain leaves the bloc will give firms `` more certainty '' , says lesley batchelor , director general of the institute of export .
however , she says these are only proposals and the eu still needs to agree to them .
the biggest risk of no deal would be delays .
`` if you are providing a service but your manufactured goods get stuck at border crossings your customers could lose confidence in your ability to deliver . ''

documents.title: china slaps import bans on north korea
text: china will stop importing coal , iron , iron ore and seafood from north korea starting today .
the move is an implementation of un sanctions , which were imposed earlier this month in response to north korea 's two missile tests last month .
by some estimates , the move could cost north korea about $ 1bn .
china accounts for more than 90 % of north korea 's international trade , although it greatly reduced coal imports earlier this year .
the move comes amid a backdrop of heightened tensions between the north and the us , as well as tougher language on trade between the us and china .

documents.title: inflation 'expected to rise '
text: the ons publishes inflation figures for july this morning .
the figures are expected to rise again due to the ongoing weakness of sterling and a bounce-back in commodity prices .

with the bank of england expecting inflation to rise to 3 % , and wage growth to 2 % , workers can face `` further squeezes '' on their spending power , says mouhammed choukeir , chief investment officer at kleinwort benson .

documents.title: north korea tensions 'a blip ' for markets
text: markets were rattled by us-north korea tensions last week , but many including london 's ftse 100 bounced back on monday .

mouhammed choukeir , chief investment officer at kleinwort benson , told wake up to money : `` clearly over the short run these geo-political tensions can affect markets , but over the medium to long run they have very little impact at all .
`` what will really drive the value of shares will be their economic fundamentals , so i see this as a short-term blip . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: 'we are stuck with the railways we have got '
text: as we have reported , the government will this morning announce how much rail fares could rise in 2018 .

stephen gibson , of slg economics , and former head of economics at network rail , says that while passenger numbers are up on our trains , and some lines are profitable , `` we are still paying for the under-investment of previous generations '' .
he adds : `` i think it is difficult to compare our railways with those in france , which were substantially rebuilt in the 1950s for high speed diesel and electric trains .
`` our railways were designed in the 1850s for trains of 50mph and expanding platforms , stations and tunnels is very hard .
we are stuck with the railways we have got . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: sainsbury 's takeover of nisa 'grinds to halt '
text: sainsbury 's proposed takeover of grocery wholesale group nisa has ground to a halt over competition concerns , various media have reported , quoting unnamed sources .

the exclusive talks ended late last week after the competition and markets authority expressed serious doubts about a similar , but much larger , tie up between tesco and the wholesaler booker , the guardian said .
nisa has apparently now begun talks with the co-op about a takeover .

documents.title: commuters braced for rises in regulated rail fares
text: millions of rail users in the uk are bracing themselves for news of an increase in regulated rail fares from january 2018 .
train operators are allowed to raise fares by as much as the retail prices index ( rpi ) figure for july , expected to be in the region of 3.5 % .
the exact figure will be published later this morning .
passenger groups said commuters would be worst-hit , and suggested that the rpi measure should be scrapped .
